CoreAPI empowers .NET Core developers to quickly and easily connect
releaseNotes:
# CoreAPI - Simplify API Integration in .NET Core

[![NuGet](https://img.shields.io/nuget/v/CoreAPI.svg)](https://www.nuget.org/packages/CoreAPI)
[![Build Status](https://github.com/your-username/CoreAPI/workflows/Build/badge.svg)](https://github.com/your-username/CoreAPI/actions)

## Overview

CoreAPI is a powerful and easy-to-use library for seamlessly integrating third-party APIs into your .NET Core applications. It simplifies API communication, authentication, error handling, and data serialization/deserialization, empowering you to focus on building core business logic.

## Key Features

* **Supports Popular Protocols:** REST, SOAP, GraphQL
* **Simplified Authentication:** OAuth 2.0, API Keys, Basic Authentication
* **Robust Error Handling:** Capture and manage errors gracefully
* **Flexible Configuration:** Easily customize API settings and behavior
* **Efficient Data Handling:** Effortless data serialization and deserialization
* **Comprehensive Documentation:** Detailed examples and tutorials

## Getting Started

**1. Install the NuGet package:**

```bash
Install-Package CoreAPI
```

**2. Integrate with your .NET Core project:**

```csharp
using CoreAPI;
using System.Net.Http;

// Create an API client
var client = new ApiClient("https://api.example.com");

// Set authentication (if required)
client.Authentication.SetApiKey("your-api-key");

// Make API requests
var response = await client.GetAsync("/endpoint");

// Process the response
var data = await response.Content.ReadAsAsync<YourDataType>();
```

## Examples

* **Making a GET request:**

```csharp
var response = await client.GetAsync("/endpoint");
```

* **Making a POST request:**

```csharp
var requestData = new { /* Your data */ };
var response = await client.PostAsync("/endpoint", requestData);
```

For detailed documentation, including API references, tutorials, and examples, please visit [link to your documentation].
